title: Calories in Taco Bell Cantina Chicken Bowl
meta_description: Discover calories in Taco Bell Cantina Chicken Bowl, including full nutrition breakdown with protein, carbs, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for customization.
h1: Calories in Taco Bell Cantina Chicken Bowl
assumptions: Standard Taco Bell menu item with slow-roasted chicken, seasoned rice, black beans, lettuce, pico de gallo, guacamole, and avocado ranch sauce; no customizations.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, portion size, and customizations. Check Taco Bell app or website for latest values.

quick_answer.text: One Taco Bell Cantina Chicken Bowl contains about 490 calories and 35 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Swap avocado ranch for light sour cream

faqs.q: How many calories in Taco Bell Cantina Chicken Bowl?
What's the protein in a Taco Bell Cantina Chicken Bowl?
faqs.a: About 35 g of protein from the chicken and beans.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in the Cantina Chicken Bowl?
faqs.a: Around 1250 mg, mostly from seasonings and sauce.

faqs.q: Can I make the Cantina Chicken Bowl lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, skip the rice or sauce to reduce by 50-120 kcal.

faqs.q: Are carbs high in Taco Bell Cantina Chicken Bowl?
faqs.a: About 50 g total, with 7 g fiber from beans and veggies.
